Articles.Content:
At Kennedy Space Center's Visitor Center they have something called a "Rocket Garden" (link). I have photos from when I was ten years old visiting that place and staring up in wonder at Atlas and Titan rockets. I think that might be a nice upgrade for the space centre - a place where you can put four or five rockets on display and drive rovers around them.

Only issues that come to mind is memory and parts count - some of my launchers are capable of slowing my PC on their own, five of them would melt my PC.

Thoughts?
The solution is that you'd meld each launcher in the garden into one part.
Museums that display the log and the craft have been something suggested before, but really, I have no idea why not..

The solution is that you'd meld each launcher in the garden into one part.

yep, if we could make the game turn the outside "skin" of the ship into one big part, then delete all the rest of the polygons, and take physics away, we could do this. Sadly i have no modding skills, but i bet it's possible. SQUAD PLEASE DO THIS!
I'm sure this could be used for more than just rockets - putting landers or planes on display a-la a sort of outdoor Smithsonian might be up some players' alleys too.

yep, if we could make the game turn the outside "skin" of the ship into one big part, then delete all the rest of the polygons, and take physics away, we could do this. Sadly i have no modding skills, but i bet it's possible. SQUAD PLEASE DO THIS!

Simply take the physics away. That's all you need to do*. The lag is caused mostly by each part being simulated simultaneously: if they are not being simulated, all that is happening is simple part rendering, which is not at all laggy on most systems.

*I think... this is how I would envision the problem, correct me by all means if I am incorrect.
Two years later... Parts weld them into a single model and then place them with HyperEdit or Vessel Mover.
Fun necro... I find the island airfield the perfect location for my museum pieces
Just have squad make a display option for the vehicles

On 01/11/2016 at 9:00 AM, RandyRawgust said:

Two years later... Parts weld them into a single model and then place them with HyperEdit or Vessel Mover.

With KIS/KAS, you could even build a stand and bolt them to the floor now too

Why not make them be buildings using the model of the vehicle it shouldn't be to hard I think but I have just put out actual spacecraft because you can recover them for funds in an emergency which is help full in career mode. Kind of a hidden collateral you can make the displays when you have lots of funds and when times ar tight recover one or two of them for the funds.
